com.datastax.driver.mapping

Class Mapper<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datastax.driver.mapping.Mapper<T>

  • public class Mapper<T>
extends Object
    An object handling the mapping of a particular class.

    A Mapper object is obtained from a MappingManager using the MappingManager.mapper(java.lang.Class<T>) method.

    • Method Detail

      • getManager

        public MappingManager getManager()
        The MappingManager managing this mapper.
        Returns:
        the MappingManager managing this mapper.

      • saveQuery

        public Statement saveQuery(T entity)
        Creates a query that can be used to save the provided entity.

        This method is useful if you want to setup a number of options (tracing, conistency level, ...) of the returned statement before executing it manually or need access to the ResultSet object after execution (to get the trace, the execution info, ...), but in other cases, calling save(T) or saveAsync(T) is shorter.

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to save.
        Returns:
        a query that saves entity (based on it's defined mapping).

      • save

        public void save(T entity)
        Save an entity mapped by this mapper.

        This method is basically equivalent to: getManager().getSession().execute(saveQuery(entity)).

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to save.

      • saveAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Void> saveAsync(T entity)
        Save an entity mapped by this mapper asynchonously.

        This method is basically equivalent to: getManager().getSession().executeAsync(saveQuery(entity)).

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to save.
        Returns:
        a future on the completion of the save operation.

      • deleteQuery

        public Statement deleteQuery(T entity)
        Creates a query that can be used to delete the provided entity.

        This method is a shortcut that extract the PRIMARY KEY from the provided entity and call deleteQuery(Object...) with it.

        This method is useful if you want to setup a number of options (tracing, conistency level, ...) of the returned statement before executing it manually or need access to the ResultSet object after execution (to get the trace, the execution info, ...), but in other cases, calling delete(T) or deleteAsync(T) is shorter.

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to delete.
        Returns:
        a query that delete entity (based on it's defined mapping).

      • deleteQuery

        public Statement deleteQuery(Object... primaryKey)
        Creates a query that can be used to delete an entity given its PRIMARY KEY.

        The values provided must correspond to the columns composing the PRIMARY KEY (in the order of said primary key).

        This method is useful if you want to setup a number of options (tracing, conistency level, ...) of the returned statement before executing it manually or need access to the ResultSet object after execution (to get the trace, the execution info, ...), but in other cases, calling delete(T) or deleteAsync(T) is shorter.

        Parameters:
        primaryKey - the primary key of the entity to delete, or more precisely the values for the columns of said primary key in the order of the primary key.
        Returns:
        a query that delete the entity of PRIMARY KEY primaryKey.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of value provided differ from the number of columns composing the PRIMARY KEY of the mapped class, or if at least one of those values is null.

      • delete

        public void delete(T entity)
        Deletes an entity mapped by this mapper.

        This method is basically equivalent to: getManager().getSession().execute(deleteQuery(entity)).

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to delete.

      • deleteAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Void> deleteAsync(T entity)
        Deletes an entity mapped by this mapper asynchronously.

        This method is basically equivalent to: getManager().getSession().executeAsync(deleteQuery(entity)).

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to delete.
        Returns:
        a future on the completion of the deletion.

      • delete

        public void delete(Object... primaryKey)
        Deletes an entity based on its primary key.

        This method is basically equivalent to: getManager().getSession().execute(deleteQuery(primaryKey)).

        Parameters:
        primaryKey - the primary key of the entity to delete, or more precisely the values for the columns of said primary key in the order of the primary key.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of value provided differ from the number of columns composing the PRIMARY KEY of the mapped class, or if at least one of those values is null.

      • deleteAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Void> deleteAsync(Object... primaryKey)
        Deletes an entity based on its primary key asynchronously.

        This method is basically equivalent to: getManager().getSession().executeAsync(deleteQuery(primaryKey)).

        Parameters:
        primaryKey - the primary key of the entity to delete, or more precisely the values for the columns of said primary key in the order of the primary key.
        Returns:
        a future on the completion of the deletion.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of value provided differ from the number of columns composing the PRIMARY KEY of the mapped class, or if at least one of those values is null.

      • map

        public Result<T> map(ResultSet resultSet)
        Map the rows from a ResultSet into the class this is mapper of.
        Parameters:
        resultSet - the ResultSet to map.
        Returns:
        the mapped result set. Note that the returned mapped result set will encapsulate resultSet and so consuming results from this returned mapped result set will consume results from resultSet and vice-versa.

      • getQuery

        public Statement getQuery(Object... primaryKey)
        Creates a query to fetch entity given its PRIMARY KEY.

        The values provided must correspond to the columns composing the PRIMARY KEY (in the order of said primary key).

        This method is useful if you want to setup a number of options (tracing, conistency level, ...) of the returned statement before executing it manually, but in other cases, calling get(java.lang.Object...) or getAsync(java.lang.Object...) is shorter.

        Parameters:
        primaryKey - the primary key of the entity to fetch, or more precisely the values for the columns of said primary key in the order of the primary key.
        Returns:
        a query that fetch the entity of PRIMARY KEY primaryKey.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of value provided differ from the number of columns composing the PRIMARY KEY of the mapped class, or if at least one of those values is null.

      • get

        public T get(Object... primaryKey)
        Fetch an entity based on its primary key.

        This method is basically equivalent to: map(getManager().getSession().execute(getQuery(primaryKey))).one().

        Parameters:
        primaryKey - the primary key of the entity to fetch, or more precisely the values for the columns of said primary key in the order of the primary key.
        Returns:
        the entity fetched or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of value provided differ from the number of columns composing the PRIMARY KEY of the mapped class, or if at least one of those values is null.

      • getAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<T> getAsync(Object... primaryKey)
        Fetch an entity based on its primary key asynchronously.

        This method is basically equivalent to mapping the result of: getManager().getSession().executeAsync(getQuery(primaryKey)).

        Parameters:
        primaryKey - the primary key of the entity to fetch, or more precisely the values for the columns of said primary key in the order of the primary key.
        Returns:
        a future on the fetched entity. The return future will yield null if said entity doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of value provided differ from the number of columns composing the PRIMARY KEY of the mapped class, or if at least one of those values is null.
